What should we do about it? In a straightforward talk about a controversial idea, futurist Martin Ford makes the case for separating income from traditional work and instituting a universal basic income.</p>

	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1933836672" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1933836672">Feds warn energy, aviation companies of hacking threats</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Hackers have been targeting the nuclear, energy, aviation, water and critical manufacturing industries since May, according to Reuters.</p>

	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1929420548" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1929420548">Apply 6 different type of vignette effects to your photos in Photoshop</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">In this fun tutorial by talented serbian artist Nemanja Sekulic, you will learn six different ways how to create any kind of vignette in Photoshop.  Vignette is a light fall off at the periphery compared to the image center.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotoshoproadmap.com%2Fapply-6-different-type-vignette-effects-photos-photoshop%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1929420548" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotoshoproadmap.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotoshoproadmap.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1910303533">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1910303533" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1910303533">US pressured North Korea by overwhelming hackers with data traffic</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">The US is no stranger to hacking North Korea, but it's usually in a bid to directly thwart the country's military ambitions. Now, however, those attacks are being used as a diplomatic strategy.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2Famp%2F2017%2F10%2F01%2Fus-launched-dos-attack-against-north-korea-hackers%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1910303533" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1895277040">Northrop Grumman joins the space race with $7.8 billion acquisition</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Today, Orbital ATK announced that defense contractor Northrop Grumman will acquire it for $7.8 billion in cash, with an additional $1.4 billion in debt. Orbital ATK builds rockets and constructs satellites for both commercial and military applications.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2Famp%2F2017%2F09%2F18%2Fnorthrop-grumman-acquires-orbital-atk%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1895277040" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1882078288" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1882078288">Senate will consider legislation for self-driving trucks</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">A bill on autonomous car legislation originally scheduled for a vote on September 6th just passed the US House of representatives and has been sent to the Senate for consideration.</p>

		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1848201221">Scientists may have found a functional cure for type-1 diabetes</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Type-1 diabetes is a chronic condition that affects an estimated 42 million people worldwide, and occurs when the pancreas produces little to no insulin. 	<div class="item_content">

		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1803785694" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1803785694">Microsoft made its AI work on a $10 Raspberry Pi</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">To make it work on systems that often have just a few kilobytes of RAM, the team compressed neural network parameters down to just a few bits instead of the usual 32. Another technique is "sparsification" of algorithms, a way of pruning them down to remove redundancies.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2Famp%2F2017%2F06%2F30%2Fmicrosoft-made-its-ai-work-on-a-10-raspberry-pi%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1803785694" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1801342795">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1801342795" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1801342795">US hit by cyberattack that targeted Ukraine and Russia</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Yesterday, a number of Ukrainian and Russian companies and state agencies reported being hit by a cyberattack, the results of which ranged from flight delays at Boryspil airport to a shutdown of Chernobyl nuclear power plant's automatic radiation monitoring system.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1782218685">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_webview" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Frichard_browning_how_i_built_a_jet_suit%3Frss&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>

	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1777590780" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1777590780">Self-navigating cargo ships will use AI to plot their course</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Japanese shipping companies want to build self-navigating cargo ships. Working alongside shipbuilders, their goal is to develop new technology that can predict malfunctions, reduce maritime accidents and improve efficiency.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-load" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2F2017%2F06%2F09%2Fself-navigating-cargo-ships-ai-plot-course%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1777590780" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">
		<div class="favstate"></div>
	<ul class="sub clearfix">

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1752868415">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1752868415" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1752868415">Bill Gates: Try a career in artificial intelligence, energy or bioscience to make an impact</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Congratulations! You've just accomplished something I never managed to do—earn a college degree.  Between your commencement speaker and every aunt and uncle at your graduation party, I am sure you are getting a lot of advice. At the risk of piling on, I thought I would share a few thoughts.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-load" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnbc.com%2F2017%2F05%2F21%2Fbill-gates-artificial-intelligence-energy-bioscience-best-jobs.html&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1752868415" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcnbc.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">
		<div class="favstate"></div>
	<ul class="sub clearfix">

		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1758321894">SpaceX test-fires the booster of its most powerful rocket</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Sorry folks, things are about to get heavy, by which we mean that SpaceX has begun test-firing the boosters for the Falcon Heavy. The company posted a clip of the event from last week, showing a side booster being put through its paces.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-load" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2F2017%2F05%2F25%2Fspacex-begins-test-firing-parts-of-its-biggest-rocket%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1758321894" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fengadget.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">
		<div class="favstate"></div>
	<ul class="sub clearfix">
	<li class="original_url_container"><a class="original_url" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com%2F2017%2F05%2F25%2Fspacex-begins-test-firing-parts-of-its-biggest-rocket%2F&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="View Original">engadget.com</a></li>

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1748571375">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1748571375" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1748571375">Advanced Photo Manipulation Techniques: Creating Realistic Smoke Effects</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Finish the smoke with this next video. Add in some more layers to make it stand out, and then blend any harsh edges for a realistic result. When you're finished, move on to masking and preparing the model we'll be using in the next step.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdesign.tutsplus.com%2Ftutorials%2Fadvanced-photo-manipulation-techniques-creating-realistic-effects--cms-28771&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1748571375" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdesign.tutsplus.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdesign.tutsplus.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

		<span class="thumb lazy-load" variant="[object Object]" data-lazy-type="thumbnail" data-lazy-key="1744128974" data-thumburl="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcms-assets.tutsplus.com%2Fuploads%2Fusers%2F166%2Fposts%2F28615%2Ffinal_image%2FSilver%252080s%2520Text%2520Effect%2520QT%2520-%2520850.jpg&amp;resize=w888-nc&amp;f=t" data-thumbvariant="2" data-tileclass="normal" data-shouldcache="true" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>

		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1745493869">Advanced Photo Manipulation Techniques: Working With Patterns</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">In order for the lava to blend into the rock elements, we'll need to adjust the perspective. Using the Free Transform Tool (Control-T), adjust the shape and position of the lava pattern with options like Distort, Warp, and Perspective.  Brighten up the lava by using a New Layer set to Color Dodge.</p>

	<div class="item_content">

	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_articleview" href="/a/read/1635792907" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1635792907">Uber used 'Greyball' tool to evade authorities around the world</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Saying this week could've gone better for Uber is a massive understatement. After its SVP resigned over undisclosed sexual harassment investigations and its CEO argued with one of the company's own drivers for complaining about its lower pay, Friday might have seemed like the end of a long few days.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 153.72px;"></span>

		<a class="title" href="/a/read/1628807563">The Art Of Calligraphy: Getting Started And Lessons Learned</a>

Roboticist Jonathan Rossiter explains how this special swimming machine, which uses a microbial fuel cell to neutralize algal blooms and oil slicks, could be a precursor to biodegradable, autonomous pollution-fighting robots.</p>

		<a class="item_link start_webview" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fjoshua_smith_new_nanotech_to_catch_cancer_early&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fjoshua_smith_new_nanotech_to_catch_cancer_early&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910">New nanotech to detect cancer early</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">What if every home had an early-warning cancer detection system? Researcher Joshua Smith is developing a nanobiotechnology "cancer alarm" that scans for traces of disease in the form of special biomarkers called exosomes. In this forward-thinking talk, he shares his dream for how we might revolutionize cancer detection and, ultimately, save lives.</p>

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1590950488">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_webview" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fsue_klebold_my_son_was_a_columbine_shooter_this_is_my_story&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fsue_klebold_my_son_was_a_columbine_shooter_this_is_my_story&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910">My son was a Columbine shooter. This is my story</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Sue Klebold is the mother of Dylan Klebold, one of the two shooters who committed the Columbine High School massacre, murdering 12 students and a teacher. She's spent years excavating every detail of her family life, trying to understand what she could have done to prevent her son's violence. In this difficult, jarring talk, Klebold explores the intersection between mental health and violence, advocating for parents and professionals to continue to examine the link between suicidal and homicidal thinking.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-load" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fsue_klebold_my_son_was_a_columbine_shooter_this_is_my_story&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1590950488" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fted.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1579407017">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_webview" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fcaleb_barlow_where_is_cybercrime_really_coming_from&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fcaleb_barlow_where_is_cybercrime_really_coming_from&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910">Where is cybercrime really coming from?</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 162px;">Cybercrime netted a whopping $450 billion in profits last year, with 2 billion records lost or stolen worldwide. Security expert Caleb Barlow calls out the insufficiency of our current strategies to protect our data. His solution? We need to respond to cybercrime with the same collective effort as we apply to a health care crisis, sharing timely information on who is infected and how the disease is spreading. If we're not sharing, he says, then we're part of the problem.</p>
		<span class="thumb" variant="[object Object]" style="height: 176.72px;"></span>
		<img class="favicon lazy-active" data-originalurl="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fcaleb_barlow_where_is_cybercrime_really_coming_from&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" data-lazy-type="favicon" data-lazy-key="1579407017" data-favicon-url="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fted.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi" src="https://d33ypg4xwx0n86.cloudfront.net/direct?url=http%3A%2F%2Fted.com%2Ffavicon.ico&amp;f=fi">
		<div class="favstate"></div>
	<ul class="sub clearfix">
	<li class="original_url_container"><a class="original_url" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ted.com%2Ftalks%2Fcaleb_barlow_where_is_cybercrime_really_coming_from&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="View Original">ted.com</a></li>

	<div class="item_content">

</li><li class="item item_type_normal_excerpt adjusted" id="i1562350860">
	<div class="item_content">
		<a class="item_link start_webview" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fthekidshouldseethis.com%2Fpost%2Fclassical-music-mashup-ii-52-classical-pieces-from-31-composers&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"></a>
		<a class="title" href="https://getpocket.com/redirect?url=http%3A%2F%2Fthekidshouldseethis.com%2Fpost%2Fclassical-music-mashup-ii-52-classical-pieces-from-31-composers&amp;formCheck=6dadf3cd8003c5e2bf52212087c88910">Classical Music Mashup II: 52 classical pieces from 31 composers</a><p class="excerpt" style="height: 144px;">Tchaikovsky, Mozart, Verdi, Mendelssohn, Bach, Grieg, and many more composers’ little heads can be seen in this Classical Music Mashup II by Grant Woolard, a follow up to his previous Classical Music Mashup.  This version layers 52 classical pieces from 31 composers in six minutes.</p>
